qas.question: How much did Barcelona pay to acquire Johan Cruyff?
For what team did Cruyff refuse to play?
What dictator's rule was Cruyff's reason for avoiding Real Madrid?
What award did Cruyff win during his first year with Barcelona?
When did Cruyff win his third Ballon d'Or?

context: The 1973–74 season saw the arrival of Johan Cruyff, who was bought for a world record <a0_0>£920,000<a0_0/> from Ajax. Already an established player with Ajax, Cruyff quickly won over the Barcelona fans when he told the European press that he chose Barcelona over <a1_0>Real Madrid<a1_0/> because he could not play for a club associated with <a2_0>Francisco Franco<a2_0/>. He further endeared himself when he named his son Jordi, after the local Catalan Saint George. Next to champions like Juan Manuel Asensi, Carles Rexach and Hugo Sotil, he helped the club win the 1973–74 season for the first time since 1960, defeating Real Madrid 5–0 at the Bernabéu along the way. He was crowned <a3_0>European Footballer of the Year<a3_0/> in 1973 during his first season with Barcelona (his second Ballon d'Or win; he won his first while playing for Ajax in 1971). Cruyff received this prestigious award a third time (the first player to do so) in <a4_0>1974<a4_0/>, while he was still with Barcelona.
